metadata.Title: CVE-2015-6938 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the file browser innotebook/notebookapp.py in IPython Notebook before 3.2.2 and JupyterNotebook 4.0.x before 4.0.5 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary webscript or HTML via a folder name.  NOTE: this was originally reported as across-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerability, but this may beinaccurate.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-6938` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ipython - 2.4.1-1
ipython-notebook - 2.4.1-1
ipython-notebook-common - 2.4.1-1
ipython-qtconsole - 2.4.1-1
ipython3 - 2.4.1-1
ipython3-notebook - 2.4.1-1
ipython3-qtconsole - 2.4.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ipython package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.1-1').
